result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean A. Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts by 7/5/2022, or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.
AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain a mental health evaluation and follow through with any treatment or counseling deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt: 8:38 AM Defendant Dean A. Perry in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Dean A. Perry. Count 2, dismissed and read-in on State's motion. Count 1, Plea of guilty.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. Court orders 60 days in county jail with Huber privileges - stayed.  12 months probation.  Conditions of probation: Obtain a mental health evaluation and follow through with any recommend counseling and/or treatment, AODA and follow through with any counseling and/or treatment, Pursue employment, Court costs of $443 plus the $100 DV surcharge.  Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office. Payment plan application provided to defendant.

9:31 AM Defendant Dean A. Perry in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Breanna Magallones appeared by video for Dean A. Perry. Case needs to be set for PLEAS.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status hearing on May 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dean A. Perry appeared by video, Attorney Breanna Magallones appeared in court for Dean A. Perry, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Magallones received complaint, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Court accepts waiver and enters pleas. Counsel to schedule with judicial assistant for further proceedings. bond continued.
